moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4 g6: This will create dark square weaknesses that black will later regret.
moves.3. Bd3 Bg7 4. Be3: The natural developing move Nf3 is slightly better.
moves.4... c5: Alternative variation: 4... d5 5. exd5 exd5 6. Nf3 [is only minuscule better for white.]
moves.5. c3: Alternative variation: 5. dxc5 [ Amazingly is stronger.] Bxb2 6. Nd2 Bxa1 [A mistake.] 7. Qxa1 f6 8. Nc4 [ with a better game.]
moves.7. Ne2: Alternative variation: 7. Nc3 [ is slightly better. Obviously not Qxb2?? 8. Nb5] Qxb2 8. Nb5 Na6 9. a3
moves.7... Qxb2:
White's counterplay is too great.
Alternative variation: 7... d5 8. Nbc3 Ne7 9. Qd2 [ with a slight edge for white.]
moves.8. Nbc3 Qb6 9. Rc1 Na6 10. Nb5 Bf8: Alternative variation: 10... Ne7 [ is a little better.] 11. d5 Qa5+ 12. Bd2 Qb6 13. Qa4 exd5 14. Qa3 [ And black has a lot of problems.]
moves.11. O-O d6:
Black's position is falling apart.
Alternative variation: 11... Qd8 [And black survives longer.] 12. Qa4 f6 13. Bf4 Kf7 14. Bc7 [and black is constrained.] Qe8 15. Nd6+
moves.12. d5 Qa5 13. Bd4: Alternative variation: 13. dxe6 [Is stronger.] Bxe6 (13... fxe6 14. Nf4) 14. Bd4 f6 15. Nf4
moves.13... e5 14. Bc3 Qd8 15. f4 f6 16. fxe5:
The open file for the rook will be ruinous.
Alternative variation: 16... dxe5 17. d6 Bh6 [ Is not as bad.] 18. Bd2
moves.17. Qa4 Bd7 18. Bb4: Alternative variation: 18. Qa3 [Is stronger.] Nh6 (18... Nc5 19. Bxe5 dxe5 20. Rxc5 Bxc5+ 21. Qxc5) 19. Bxe5 Qb6+ (19... dxe5 20. Rxf8+ Rxf8 21. Nd6+ Ke7 22. Nxb7+) 20. Bd4
moves.18... Nh6: Alternative variation: 18... Nf6 [Is a little safer.]
moves.19. Kh1:
White misses the winning move.
Alternative variation: 19. Rxf8+ Kxf8 20. Bxd6+ Kg8 21. Bxe5 Nf7 22. Bb2 Rc8 23. Qd4 [Leads to complicated tactical threats]
moves.19... Nf7 20. Qa3: Alternative variation: 20. Qb3 Be7 21. Rxf7 Kxf7 22. Nxd6+ Bxd6 23. Bxd6 Qf6 24. Qa3 Rae8 25. Ng3 Kg7 26. Rf1 Qg5 27. Qb2 Nb8 28. Qxb7
moves.20... Nc5: Alternative variation: 20... Be7 [Is much safer.] 21. Nxd6+ Bxd6 22. Bxd6 Nxd6 23. Bxa6 Qe7 24. Bd3
moves.21. Nxd6+: Alternative variation: 21. Bxc5 [ Is apparently crushing.] dxc5 22. d6 Nxd6 23. Qxc5 Nxb5 (23... Bxb5 24. Bxb5+ Nxb5 25. Qxb5+ Qd7 26. Qxe5+) 24. Qxe5+ [is crushing.]
moves.21... Bxd6 22. Bxc5 Bxc5 23. Qxc5 Qe7: Alternative variation: 23... b6 [ first is a little better because it makes it harder for white to play d6.]
moves.24. Qc7: Alternative variation: 24. d6 [is slightly stronger.] Qxd6 (24... Nxd6 25. Nc3 Bc6 26. Nd5 Bxd5 27. Qxd5 a6 28. Rc7 Qxc7 29. Qxe5+ Kd7 30. Qg7+) 25. Bc4
moves.24... Nd6 25. Qa5 h5:
Suddenly black's game is worse.
Alternative variation: 25... a6 [ allows black to defend Rc7 with Rc8.]
Everything goes bad after this.
Alternative variation: 31... Qf6 32. Rc1 [takes some of the pressure off.]
moves.32. h3 g5: Alternative variation: 32... Rxe6 33. dxe6 Qxe6 [allows black to live longer.]
moves.33. Qb2: Alternative variation: 33. Qe3 g4 34. Nc5 Qg7 35. Rxd7 [ is a little stronger.]
moves.33... Nb5: Alternative variation: 33... Rxe6 34. dxe6 Qxe6 35. Rc5 Nf7 36. Qxb7 [is less disastrous.]
moves.34. Bxb5: Alternative variation: 34. Rxb7 [ Wins faster, but this leads to many complicated lines.]
moves.34... axb5 35. Qxe5 h4: Alternative variation: 35... Rf1+ [Is a little better.] 36. Kh2 Rf6 37. Rxb7
moves.36. Rxb7: If black take s with either piece on e6 it will prevent forced mate, but at great cost.
moves.36... Rf1+ 37. Kh2: Now Bxe6 delays mate, not that it matters.
moves.37... Qf6: Alternative variation: 37... Rf6 38. Rb8+ Kf7 39. Nxg5+
